nodes.description: 伊斯兰抵抗组织策划并执行首次大规模自杀式爆炸，袭击法国军事基地，造成298名士兵死亡
nodes.support_text: Its 1,800kg cargo of high explosives detonated on impact, tearing the building to rubble. Two hundred and ninety-eight soldiers died in the bombings.

nodes.description: 抵抗组织将自杀式爆炸作为核心战略，推动巴勒斯坦抵抗从暴力抗议升级为独立战争
nodes.support_text: Hamas and Islamic Jihad have made human bombs - to give them a politically neutral designation - the centpiece of a new strategy to take the intifada from a violent, high-intensity public protest into a popular war of independence.

nodes.description: 统计显示巴勒斯坦在抵抗行动中已造成600人死亡、2万人受伤
nodes.support_text: So far, this intifada has seen 600 Palestinians killed and 20,000 injured.

nodes.description: 分析指出自杀式爆炸在军事层面具有低成本高伤亡优势
nodes.support_text: Militarily, human bombs are cost-effective: just one can inflict multiple casualties.

nodes.description: 宗教意识形态推动自杀式抵抗，将自我牺牲与伊斯兰教义中的殉道精神结合
nodes.support_text: Faiths don't operate in a vacuum and the dominant context in the West Bank and Gaza has been the Israeli occupation. Consequently, resurgent Islam has expressed itself in the language of resistance.

nodes.description: 伊斯兰教法权威人物称自杀式爆炸为抵抗压迫的正当手段
nodes.support_text: Sheikh Yusuf al-Qaradawi calls the bombs 'commendable' and 'among the greatest form of holy struggle against oppression'.

nodes.description: 抵抗组织领袖以非对称战争逻辑回应针对平民的袭击问题
nodes.support_text: When you are at war with an enemy that does not respect the distinction between combatant and civilian, you cannot let it attack your people with impunity.

nodes.description: 明确抵抗行动与以色列占领的系统性压迫形成直接对抗关系
nodes.support_text: The change of strategy was always on the cards. Sooner or later the cost of taking on the Middle East's most powerful army with rocks was going to become onerous.

edges.support_text: Combining elements of surprise, zeal and self-sacrifice, Islamic Jihad, later to become Hizbullah, had forced two of the world's biggest powers to turn tail.
Two hundred and ninety-eight soldiers died in the bombings. So far, this intifada has seen 600 Palestinians killed and 20,000 injured.
The attacks remain the benchmark for all 'suicide bombers'. They have proved particularly inspiring to the Palestinian Islamist resistance.
But their biggest impact is on the psychological level. The fighter who believes in what he is fighting for is a better soldier than the one who doesn't.
The change of strategy was always on the cards. Sooner or later the cost of taking on the Middle East's most powerful army with rocks was going to become onerous.
Polls in the Middle East show 75% of people in favour of martyr-bombings. They also carry the weight of religious authority.
What this does not answer, of course, is the ethical problem of bombing civilian centres. Can there ever be any moral justification in harming non-combatants?
To do so would be tantamount...
